Name: Norman Giamatti
Address: Langley, Sask.
Birthplace: Vienna, Austria, Europe

1. INDUSTRIAL HISTORY
What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1913
Where did you set up housekeeping? E.F.H., B.C.A.T., Sept. 14, Long 32 - W1
Where had you been living before that? South Dakota, U.S.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 5 men, family
How far was it to your nearest store? 20 mi.
How often could a visit be made to the store? 2-3 times a year.
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Tea, coffee, sugar, salt, matches, etc.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

In what quantities did you buy it? 50 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $6.00

12. WATER SUPPLY

There did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (Well, river, slough, dugout) ... A fresh water running out from creek.

How far was this water from your home? ........... 3 miles down hill.

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) ....... barrel.

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

So had good water for cooking, but hard, latter, about 20, put in a large cement cistern under kitchen, and then had a dug out, made, so filter the water in to well, so now have plenty good water supply.
There was no water for drinking and for cooking (well, river, stream).

If so, how was this water from your house?

How was it brought to the house? (pail, barrel, tank)

Any other water supply? Mention any charges which have been taken place since you first started homesteading, giving dates where possible.

We had good water for everything but hard.

Water, about 1-2 years, just in a large cistern, rain water.

Flower, and then had a dug out, made, no plant, no water in it until, no more than plenty of water on top.
